SENT.plain: A left ophthalmoplegia and right hemiplegia were due to thrombosis of an intracavernous aneurysm with occlusion of the left internal carotid artery
Ophthalmoplegia with contralateral hemiplegia is probably a rare syndrome
Thrombosis of an intracavernous aneurysm is probably a rare cause of occlusion of the internal carotid artery
